app.desc:
The Arduino Leonardo is a microcontroller board based on the ATmega32U4, developed in conjunction with Adafruit.

It has 20 digital input/output pins (of which 7 can be used as PWM outputs and 12 as analog inputs), a 16 MHz crystal oscillator, a micro USB connection, a power jack, an ICSP header and a reset button.

It contains everything needed to support the microcontroller; simply connect it to a computer with a micro USB cable to get started. - - More Info
